reviews.review: This is a great game. Great gameplay, great story, great fun. Please, I ask that you play both Portal and Portal 2, as they are the best games I've played in a LONG time.
Not only is this the best game ever, it is the best game that could ever possibly exist in all possible space-time continua.

La continuación al mejor juego de PC que se haya hecho. Si les encantó el sentido del humor negro y macabro de la I.A. del anterior, este llenará completamente sus espectativas. Realmente espero que este sea el juego del año, y a pesar de ser secuela, definitivamente es un juego innovador en todo los sentidos, con el recién añadido modo de multijugador, prácticamente Valve nos ha dado a los fanes lo que le habíamos exigido por años. ¡en hora buena!
Superb, the best co-op game I have ever played.
i really enjoy this game. let me know if anyone wants to play the co op.
Buy it - the humor is fantastic, animation splendid and the puzzles are awesome. Best game I've played in years.

It's an excellent game, but like the first Portal game, I found that the replay value is quite small because once you figured out the puzzles then there's no challenge about it. At the time of writing (June 19, 2011) I read of rumors of DLC which should put more levels in it, so that should increase some replay value. The SDK was released too so people are making their own levels. But for now, nothing solid as of yet, but replay value has the potential to be increased.

The single player game is very good, incorporates the usual humor found in the first game while the puzzles itself are good. Valve expanded on the plot and it's very engaging and there's a lot of new stuff to learn about in the Portal universe. Puzzles are also great fun.

Co-op is a nice addition and is really fun if you play with a friend, personally I haven't played online with other strangers so I can't comment what the online playerbase is like in this game. But if with a friend, then it can provide lots of fun.

Note: I am waiting for someone to play the coop levels who have NOT yet played them.  So it looks at this point that will be a future sale that I purchase for a freind.
- This game is awesome.  Rather than compare it to Portal one, I'll treat as a standalone title.  

I enjoyed this game a lot.  It is almost 100% platform jumping, critical thinking, and physics puzzles.  I've played almost all of the FPS puzzle games and this one ranks pretty high.  The humor is fairly good and occasionally laugh out loud.  The game makes you feel smart when you finally figure out a puzzle.

The single player only takes about 6 hours or less to beat.  Some of the levels are fun to replay, but the negitive side is that a majority of the travel type levels are boring and linear in problem solving.  A good chunk of the game is only able to be solved on one solution, compared to other FPS puzzle games that generally allow you to create your own method.

I heavily recomend it if you liek this sort of thing.
Not buying this game is insane!!!
Best ending ever.
O MELHOR JOGO DE SEMPRE!!!
Better than the first. Its my favorite singleplayer game and 2nd favorite game. (For now.) You should DEFINITLY GET THIS! Its AWESOME!

Fun game that maintains a similar feel to the original Portal while also setting itself as a distinct game. Puzzles are clever as expected and humor is on-par with the first Portal. Co-op serves as a seamless continuation of gameplay and a good way to have fun with friends.
One Word.... EPIC!

One of the best videogames I've ever played. The graphics are a bit dated but it still looks pretty good. And the puzzles aren't as difficult as the ones in the first Portal. Still enjoyed it very, very much. The story was cool (with a couple of vague backstories, if you look for them), the voice acting excellent (had a few laugh out loud moments) and the gameplay, well, it's pretty much the same as Portal 1, except that you now have gel that speeds things up and gel that bounces. Because of the many different elements you now have at your disposal there are definitely a few puzzles that require some deep thinking (hey, I didn't say all puzzles were easy :)). The co-op mode has its own puzzles that are just as fun. But it also has a downside; there are a few moments that require twitch shooting, meaning you have to react really fast if you want to make it to the end. But never mind all that, go play this game !

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]

A thoroughly enjoyable puzzle game, that isn't just more of the first one. The puzzles are enjoyable, though a bit easy at times, and the plot is unlike anything you would expect (Well, parts of it).

Completely worth the money, especially with custom content and co-op

I will start by saying this is not Game Of The Year. 

While it is good, there's something I really am not liking, namely microtransactions (yes, I couldn't believe it either) despite the game already costing a lot, aswell as being short and not AS inventive as it should be. It does have it's glorious moments, but it's not brilliant all-round.


I'd call it 8 out of 10, but the price HAS TO drop.
Just play it and you will know.

Valve are gods of the video game industry. A worthy sequel to the brilliant Portal game and improves on that game in every respect. The characters and humour bring the world of Aperture Science to life with the best voice acting in any game ever and the story has one of the most surprising and satisfying endings I've ever played through. Source looks better than ever and still produces silky smooth performance. Shows what Valve are capable of and really gets me excited for the next Half Life game.

- We're done here.

This sequel I found to be extremely fun with a slight challenge. The added coop feature is amazing, teaming up with a friend to try and solve the puzzles is a blast. With the added gestures and humorous style that we know and love from the first Portal makes this game that much better. This game is a must if you enjoy a good challenge!

If indeed you have played the first one and liked it and were hoping this game lives up to your expectations than quit being a fool and just buy this shit. It's amazing and will exceed your expectations 10 fold.

La suite du célèbre Portal !

Un jeu compressé en temps mais fort en idées !

A saisir absolument pour tout fan de Black Mesa / Aperture Science !
compleatly worth the money.

This game is exactly as good as everyone was hoping it would be...so yea really good. This game is not hard per say but what is so ingenious about it is that the levels are designed so well that it drives just to the point of stumping you but then making you feel smart again. You start to get a ephoric response to testing and the addition of 2 more portals in the coop is even more fun. This is an A list game, easily the best game of 2011 and is another example of vavle getting it right.
One of the best games I've ever played. Takes the concept from its predecessor and puts into a world as rich and deep as Half Life. Super-engrossing and fun.

Awesome in every way!

This is one of my absolute favorite games ever! Unique concept, Chillax if you want or go crazy if thats your speed!

It's Portal 2.
I shouldn't have to say anything more than that.

You're a fool for not picking this title up.  Seriously.

A FOOL.
Obra maestra.....¿es necesatio decir más?
Well it's definitely good. Maybe worth $50.

Where do I begin with this one? I liked Portal a lot, but Portal 2 got its hooks in me like very, very few games do. If you liked Portal for its gameplay, there's more than enough reason to enjoy Portal 2. It's more of the same puzzle oriented gameplay, now with a few new twists. However, if it's the personality and writing of the first game that sold you on it, then there's really no reason for you not to have played Portal 2 by now. Calling a sequel "bigger and better" than the first is a really tired cliché, but it's genuinely true about Portal 2. Few games have the character and personality that this one has.
Potato clocks are fun
Think like Portals
CA-PO-LA-VO-RO! Miglior gioco del 2011!

This game is not as good as portal, few sequals ever are. Of course it could not recapture its magic. That said, it has a magic of its own and i enjoyed every second of playing this game. First night Bonechatters and i played through almost the entire co-op mode, until my power went out. There are few games that ever hold my attention for that long in one sitting.

This was a triumph and now here we are again.

Amazing Game

Perhaps one of the best games to ever come out, it is truly worth the time and money. This is truly 100% the real gaming experience, something so many games nowadays fail to reproduce. This game lets you know that the art form has not been lost.
Well done. Here come the test results: “You are a horrible person.” That’s what it says. We weren’t even testing for that.

Think of your favorite movie.  Now think of how much you'd enjoy watching a trailer for that movie.  The trailer is Portal -  a glimpse of the bigger, longer, prettier, and more enjoyable full feature, which is Portal 2.  If you don't read further, read this:
Buy it.  It's your kind of game.  You'll love it.

My biggest complaint - Throughout the entire game I felt the nagging dread that it might end too soon.  This is partly because I was too aware that I didn't want the euphoric gaming experience to end.  Also largely to blame, though, is the plot, which rests constantly on the brink of ultimate catastrophe.  And while it givies the sense that things could end at any time, it DOES make for an unusually exciting puzzle game.  I took around 11-12 hours to complete the single player game, but it felt like only 3.  Verdict - Portal 2 ends painfully too soon, spitting you back into a world that no longer looks as vivid as it did before you'd began.
Extremely fun game.  Makes you think and has the kind of humor you will want to repeat over and over.
A great puzzle game with a humourous and enjoyable story, definitely worth a play! 10/10!

Portal 2 is a fantastic game but i would recommend playing Portal first.
Absoleutely brilliant!

Whether you are a puzzle game fan, a FPS fan, or you hate videogames altogether...
Portal 2 will not fall short of a great game with an amazing plot and puzzles that will have you thinking, but not quitting. 10/10.

Extreme game, hours with entertainment.
ValVE has done it again!
You HAVE to buy this game, it is beyond amazing!

OMG! another top game by top creators again. This just raised the bar for how games should be produced. champain was longer than the first which was great but nothing too hard which i also love, the one great thing about this game is that you will not be able to leave this game without a smile or a good laugh.
This game is amazing.  It keeps the same feel as the original Portal while adding new material and challenges.  Co-op is alot of fun, and requires a bit of thinking, which adds to the experience.
Finally! Gotta love you some Portal.

This is the best videogame.

I genuinely hope that I one day find a game better than portal 2, but that day has yet to come. 

Every single thing about this game is incredible, and not a second of this masterpiece is wasted. Please, please play this game. 

(Also play the first one first because it's also very good)

Amazing game. Not quite up to the original, but that doesn't surprise me. I don't think anything ever could be. Portal 2 looks gorgeous, has amazing writing, and still has some twists and turns. Unfortunately, some sections of the game feature levels that far too large, and the game does drag on a bit at times. Also, many puzzles are difficult not because you can't figure out how to solve them but because you haven't noticed the one tiny section of portalable surface. Still, a fantastic game, just not the perfection that was the first.

Impecável na história, na inovação, nos gráficos, no áudio.
Com outras palavras, Portal 2 é um game com tudo pra ser perfeito.
Every bit as good as the original.  Packed full of character, it's proof that the artistry involved in creating video games is not yet dead.

Awesome game, the single player was spot on for my high expectations, challenging puzzles, and new mechanics.  The co-op is a lot of fun too, adding a degree of timing and teamwork to what was experienced in the original Portal.  I can't wait until they expand on the content!

Valve have outdone themselves with the sequel to Portal, bringing you more levels, more Glados and more fun! We even have Co-Op and new mad quotes to learn to annoy people on 4chan. I played this game over about 3 days and loved it! The only other games that have ever done that to me were Bioshock and ME2. Totally immersive, fun and you learn a bit more about the secrets and past of Aperture Science! Now with the history cleared up, maybe Valve can finally get Half Life 2: Episode 3 underway? There was a hint of Aperture Science in there, so fingers crossed!
Great game, 100% adictive and very funny!

Awesome game!  Beats the hell into the original.  More fun as a Co-op but needs more co-op chambers, which is a let down because there isn't that much at the moment.  Amazing game thow!

Graphics: The graphics are actually pretty cool to look at and it makes a change from a Valve game, when all their games are the same graphics across the board... Talk about copy paste... Hear they are improved upon.

Audio: The audio is amusing, delightful and fun to listen too from running to talking to the bots communicating or even the game dialogue.

Controls:The controls are super easy to use and get used too, nothing special or hard to grasp.

Game: The game is a massive step forward from the original Portal because now you have coop and a singleplayer campaign.. Both two different set of chambers to enjoy and that is amazing.... You can do the campaign which has it's own missions to solve and then do coop with a friend which is a totally different back story to the game and the game is so much fun with some amazing amusing moments from the cast of the game.

The only sad thing is there is not many official chambers to do and once done, they are done and you must rely on the workshop to have more fun....

Would I recommend the game? Yes without a doubt.
Now with less cake!

Digital Orgasm achieved in the opening sequence! so epic!

Great voice acting/story, alot of fun challenges + one of the best endings to a game I've ever seen.

BUY THIS GAME NOW!!!!
Stephen Merchant ftw!
A worthy sequel, though you may want to wait for a sale. It took me only 6.5 hours to complete the single-player portion of the game.
Brain-bending puzzles built-in, a multitude of additional puzzles accessable via steam-workshop, plus  excellent co-op play make for some seriously good times!
if you have portal,  i suggest you buy ant try this one as well, if anyone wants to try coop with me or wants help, i have the startegy guide for this game, if you think you might need it

Portal 2 was good fun.  The single-player story is rock solid and the world is amazingly detailed.  I caught myself looking around at things instead of playing the game a bunch of times because the world is just so inviting.  The single-player story by itself is worth the price of admission.

But then there's co-op.  There isn't much that can be said about co-op Portal.  It's something you just have to experience for yourself.  I played with a few different people and each experience was different.  It was a good time watching some of them try to figure out how to solve the puzzles while I mostly got them killed and gave up figuring the puzzles out for myself.

All around fun here and something that should be in your Steam collection.
Buy it, for science.
AWESOME GAME

Continuando a Historia de Portal, GLaDOS reacorda e continua a fazer suas facanhas.
Portal 2 tem o melhor, Possui modo Cooperativo (Camara de testes para 2 pessoas)
Recomendo comprar quando vier promoção.
More of dem portals! And coop portals!
Best game of 2011, fact

Portal 2 ein Spiel wo man schon sein Hirn manchmal anstrengen muss, wenn man jedoch das Rätsel gelöst hat, stellt man jedoch fest, dass es eigentlich ganz einfach war, man hätte eben einfach nur früher drauf kommen müsssen.

Die Dialoge, die die Charaktere führen (hauptsächlich Gladdos und Wheatley) sind sehr unterhaltsam.
Man kann also auch mal ruhig stehen bleiben und einfach nur zu hören, was diese Charaktere sagen.

Spiel, Spass und Spannung, alles dabei.

If you've played the first Portal, you'll already be looking forward to this one. But before you think that its just going to be more of the same, you're completely wrong. There's more surprises in Portal 2 and you'll enjoy every minute of it!
LOVE IT
One of the most well-done games I've ever played.  Fantastic writing, great level design, and all-around interesting.

The bitch is back for more in Portal 2 with bigger set pieces, more devious puzzles and a more evolved storyline to go with it. This title has a lot to live up to when compared with its predecessor but despite some slightly repetitive elements, overall it's a fantastic sequel. 

My particular favourites included more of the black humor and some brilliant travel through some parts of the Aperture labs that I was not expecting to see. 

Add to that a great co-op mode that furthers both the story and the puzzle elements and this is another title you won't want to miss.
Amazing...! What an experience. Funny, clever, enjoyable. Do yourself a favour and play it!
Great game, too bad it's so short ...
This game is awesome. Buy it, play it, win it. Bam yo!

It's faster paced than portal 1, new mechanics work well and don't feel rushed.
Worth it if portal is interesting to you.
Fun, hilarious, awesome.
The second coming.
hour s of entertainment without actually killing anyone! (Robots dont count)

[h1]95 / 100[/h1]


Frustratingly Addictive Gameplay .. very fun!


[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/TrueBlueReviews#curation]If you enjoyed reading this review, please follow [u]True Blue Reviews[/u] for more recommendations![/url]

After 4 and a half years without a singleplayer, Valve's crowning jewl to the gaming world, release Portal 2's anouncement not only came as a suprise to many, but hit with a serious impact, as a guy who didn't start gaming till years after Half-Life Two released, I've had to settle with Valve's mulitplayer releases, it's not to say Valve doesn't do Multiplayer well, but they do singeplayer like gods. After a 2 week ARG and waiting 4 years, at 12 PM April 19th, I evperienced Portal 2 for the first time and let me tell you, this game is phonomanal, the gameplay, the characters, the story, everything about it screamed the amazing singleplayer Valve is famous for. Not only did Valve deliver, they blew away my expectations, the game is loads of fully genre bending fun, and has moments so massive for a Source game that they literally took my breath away at how amazingly well they were executed, Valve has always had a knack for making amazing vista for the player to drool over, ...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZUpggRKOms
Buy buy buy buy buy buy buy it!
a great game if you like having fun with science
"...I'm the man who's gonna BURN YOUR HOUSE DOWN......with the lemons!"

EPIC AMAZING well worth the money (and i normaly wait until games are cheaper) the game has many levels and chapters the story is much better than the first I dont know anyone who disliked it GET IT !
One of the most amazing games I have played in my life, Period.
Game of the year! (2011)
Hat was Rätzelhaftes an sich... ;-)

What a game... Beautiful graphics, amazing gameplay, great story, one of the best games I have ever played. 100/10 You have to play it to appreciate it as much as I do.
Really well worth playing.
Best Game 2011!
The single player was really fun. Can't wait to start playing the multi-player. Sounds really good.
I liked the part where I made portals

Both sequel and update to the Portal series, humor and storyline coincide beautifully without distracting one from the other in this brilliant piece of game artwork. Transformative soundtracks along with fun puzzles make no factor of this game it's downfall, with the exception that it cannot last forever. If you claim to be a game lover, then you ABSOLUTELY MUST play this.
le meilleur jeu solo depuis quelques années ! ne le ratez pas !
Tant que vous n'y avez pas joué, je ne vous connais plus.

Played the single player end to end and LOVED IT!. The narration is awesome and the characters created are classic. I am a die hard FPS and I haven't had so much fun not killing someone since wolfenstien first came on the market in '89 or in gaming terms since  forever. 
I can see why Portal Mania and associated secondary effections are on the rise. Game play is better than great and the puzzle solutions mean that you will get better no matter what!!  and whas even better It's a suitable game for all ages.
For pure enjoyment out of 10.
I give it an 8 and the loss of 2 points is because the single player was too short OR was it because I am just too damn good.
